plants.germinationNeeds: Sow seeds directly in loose, stone-free soil from spring to mid-summer. Keep soil consistently moist. Germination takes 14-21 days.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Deep, sandy loam is ideal. pH 6.0-6.8. Thin seedlings to prevent misshapen roots.

plants.germinationNeeds: Start seeds indoors 5-7 weeks before transplanting, or direct sow in mid-summer for a fall crop. Prefers cool soil.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Fertile, well-drained, moisture-retentive soil. Cool weather crop.

plants.germinationNeeds: Plant seed potatoes (tubers) after the last frost. 'Chitting' (pre-sprouting) can speed up growth.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Well-drained, loose, acidic soil (pH 5.0-6.0). 'Hill up' soil around the stems as they grow.

plants.germinationNeeds: Can be grown from seeds, sets (small bulbs), or transplants. Plant sets in early spring. Seeds need a long growing season.
plants.optimalConditions: Full sun. Fertile, well-drained soil. Consistent watering is important for large bulbs.

plants.germinationNeeds: Sow seeds in cool soil. Light is required for germination. Can be sown in succession for a continuous harvest.
plants.optimalConditions: Partial shade to full sun. Moist, well-drained soil. A cool-weather crop that can bolt in heat.
